meanings.definition: Paganizers (noun): Those who practice paganism or promote pagan beliefs.
meanings.sent1: The paganizers gathered in the forest to celebrate the solstice.
meanings.sent2: The community was divided between the pagans and the paganizers.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was jokingly called a paganizer for stealing the acorns.
meanings.sent4: Her love for nature turned her into a true paganizer of the modern age.
meanings.sent5: The colorful tapestries and mystical symbols marked the meeting place of the paganizers.

meanings.definition: Paganizers (verb): To convert or influence someone to adopt pagan beliefs or practices.
meanings.sent1: She tried to paganize her friends by inviting them to the Beltane festival.
meanings.sent2: The missionaries sought to paganize the indigenous tribes in the region.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat seemed to paganize the other pets with its playful antics.
meanings.sent4: The enchanting music had the power to paganize even the most skeptical listeners.
meanings.sent5: The ancient rituals and chants were used to paganize the new members of the coven.
